channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Oct 13
item.description:
October 13, 2020 7:44 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, Oct 13.

item.title: New trains for North-South, East-West lines unveiled
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

This is the new look of some of the trains that will run on the North-South and East-West lines (NSEWL) from 2022.

item.title: 2,500 jobs on offer in retail sector despite pandemic
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The retail sector may have taken a beating during the Covid-19 pandemic, but there are still some 2,500 jobs on offer as stores reopen and more businesses turn to e-commerce.

item.title: Man who killed mentally ill daughter freed from jail after sentence backdated
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A 66-year-old man, who killed his mentally ill adult daughter in 2018 after she pointed a knife at him, was released from prison yesterday, the day he was sentenced to two years and nine months in jail.

item.title: Lawyer jailed 21 months for consumption of meth
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A lawyer was sentenced to 21 months' jail yesterday for consuming methamphetamine, or Ice. He was caught in possession of the drug at Woodlands Checkpoint in March 2018.

item.title: Second all-women halfway house set to open in 2023
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Plans are under way to set up a second all-women halfway house in Singapore, with the facility expected to open its doors in 2023.

item.title: Hacked footage from security cameras in Singapore homes shared on porn sites
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Security cameras in Singapore homes have been hacked and the footage has been shared online.

item.title: Singapore, Indonesia agree on green lane for travel
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has agreed on a reciprocal green lane with Indonesia, allowing cross-border travel for essential business and official purposes.

item.title: NParks monitoring box jellyfish sightings in waters in Singapore
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

There had been four confirmed sightings of box jellyfish since March.

item.title: Update on fair tenancy framework in coming months
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Work is progressing on a fair tenancy framework that will establish industry norms on tenancy practices and terms, with an update expected in the coming months, Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing said yesterday.

item.title: Pritam calls for universal minimum wage starting at $1,300 for S'poreans
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Continuing the debate on minimum wage, Workers' Party (WP) chief Pritam Singh yesterday called for a universal minimum wage starting at $1,300 a month for Singaporean workers.

item.title: Lab disposes of 233 Covid-19 swab samples by accident before testing
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 233 Covid-19 swab samples were accidentally disposed of before they were tested, following lapses at a private medical lab.

item.title: $2m fund to help South East District residents, raise mental health awareness
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Institute of Technical Education second-year student Joel Ho spent four hours every day from March to September delivering food by bike to ease his family's financial stress after his father, a newspaper vendor, suffered a pay cut when the Covid-19 pandemic hit.

item.title: More grant, loan support to help companies transform
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Companies looking to increase productivity, expand overseas, or simply pivot and grow, will soon be able to tap bigger grants and expanded loan schemes.

item.title: Stroke awareness campaign shifts focus to e-platforms
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

About 8,300 stroke cases were admitted to public hospitals here in 2018, up 5 per cent from 2017, according to the latest data from the Singapore Stroke Registry.

item.title: SIA adds more A-380 lunch and dinner sessions
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has added more lunches and also dinners for its Restaurant A380 @ Changi dining experience, after the initial 900-odd seats available were sold out within 30 minutes after bookings opened at midnight on Sunday.

item.title: World's largest container ship running on LNG stops by
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The largest container ship in the world powered by liquefied natural gas (LNG) docked in Singapore on Sunday before loading up and heading onwards to Europe the next day.

item.title: Cruises to nowhere: More than 6,000 bookings in five days
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Phones have been ringing off the hook at the offices of Genting Cruise Lines, with the company receiving more than 6,000 bookings for its "cruises to nowhere" in just five days.

item.title: How to minimise risk of stroke, spot warning signs
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Stroke is the fourth-most common killer in Singapore. As the world marks World Stroke Day this month on Oct 29, here are some facts about the deadly silent killer and what can be done to prevent it.

item.title: Singapore, Indonesia establish reciprocal green lane
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Indonesia and Singapore have agreed on a reciprocal green lane, allowing cross-border travel for essential business and official purposes.

item.title: Learn how to learn, as tech skills become obsolete quickly: Expert
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Students will have to learn how to learn rather than focus on skills and specific tools as most content will be obsolete in two years or less, said the head of computing giant Nvidia's artificial intelligence (AI) technology centre Simon See.

item.title: PR who returned from India is 28th Covid-19 patient to die here
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A 64-year-old man, who had a history of hypertension, has died from complications due to Covid-19, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: Opening up Singapore to travellers from abroad: What arrangements are in place so far?
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A reciprocal green lane with Indonesia is the latest addition to the arrangements Singapore has made with countries to relax travel restrictions. Here are the arrangements so far:

item.title: Jail for man who supplied luxury items to North Korea
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

A director of three companies who unlawfully supplied luxury goods worth nearly $580,000 to North Korea was sentenced yesterday to three weeks' jail.

item.title: Fresh grad gets chance to shine at jewellery retailer
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Last year, Ms Cheryl Tan decided to take up an internship in her final year of studies at Singapore Management University, delaying her graduation by six months.

item.title: Tightened curbs for those with travel history to Sabah
item.description:
October 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Travellers with recent travel history to Sabah will be required to serve a 14-day stay-home notice (SHN), Singapore's Ministry of Health (MOH) announced yesterday.

item.title: Celebrating relationships that go beyond business
item.description:
October 13, 2020 4:00 AM

FairPrice Partners Excellence Awards 2020 features new categories and special deals for supermarket shoppers Â
